name: Air Fryer Corn Ribs
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: This is my fun take on air-fried elote ribs. Cutting the corn this way causes them to curl up in the shape of ribs once cooked. This also makes the corn a lot easier to handle and eat, not to mention a lot less messy.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon Mexican-style hot sauce (such as Valentina®)
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Place an ear of corn on a cutting board and cut in half lengthwise
Cut each half in half lengthwise
Repeat with remaining ear of corn
Whisk olive oil, chili powder, garlic powder, and black pepper together in a bowl until smooth
Brush onto both sides of each rib and place in the air fryer basket
Air fry for 12 minutes, flipping halfway through the cook time
Meanwhile whisk mayonnaise, lime juice, and hot sauce together until thoroughly combined
Transfer corn ribs to a serving plate
Drizzle sauce over the ribs and top with cotija cheese and cilantro
